intro: Ophiorrhiza liukiuensis var. yaeyamensis, commonly known as the Yaeyama ophiorrhiza, is a rare flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It is a small, shrub-like species characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or rocky slopes. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species with similar morphological features. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
